results.title: The Queen in Germany
results.creator_credit: Manfred Purzer, Ulrich Weidmann and Cinecentrum
results.brief_description: The visit of Queen Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh was a token of reconciliation between Britain and Germany. Shows the official welcome at Bonn, by the Federal President; journey by steamer up the Rhine; a performance of Die Rosenkavalier in Munich; inspection of the British garrison in Berlin; a farewell dinner on the Royal Yacht Britannia before departing from Hamburg. Narrated by George Vine.

results.title: The Queen in Canada, 1964
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling, Nicholas Balla and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A hundred years earlier, the Fathers of Confederation gathered in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, to discuss the idea of a united Canada. In October, 1964, Queen Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh came to commemorate that event and the conference at Quebec City that followed it.

results.title: The Queen Goes West
results.creator_credit: Christine Olsen, Curtis Levy and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: It was the outback’s greatest day! A big mob of cattlemen, shearers, stockmen and women gathered together to give Her Majesty the Queen a great Aussie welcome. We look at the lives of these descendants of the outback pioneers and catch the spirit of the Australian bush. Country people devoted a lot of hard yakka to make the opening of the Australian Stockman’s Hall of Fame a big success. This warm and affectionate view of their lives and this great occasion is a tribute to the enduring spirit of outback adventure.

results.title: The Queen's Plate
results.brief_description: This film describes the history of Canada’s horse-racing classic, the Queen’s Plate, and the rearing of a contender from its birth to its entry in the peak event. Queen Elizabeth presents the trophy. (Award: Cortina D’Ampezzo.)

results.title: The Queen's Navy
results.creator_credit: Derek Mayne, Frank Wells and Gaumont British Specialised Film Unit
results.brief_description: A general picture of the Royal Navy pointing out that its efficiency as a fighting force comes from mastery of self through discipline and training and mastery of science. A picture of the royal Navy, stressing that its efficiency and effectiveness rest upon three things, mastery of sea, self and science. The sea has been mastered by the inherent skill in handling ships and a knowledge of the ways of the sea traditional in British people. Mastery of self is achieved through discipline, the result of self-confidence and control, required in every training establishment. Finally mastery of science is needed, for the Royal navy of today is a highly technical force, and employs many scientific devices and weapons.

results.title: The Quadratic graph
results.brief_description: Deals with a variety of parabolas, notes their similar shapes, and investigates the differences between them. Fom the series “Visions in Mathematics”.

results.title: The Pyramids and cities of the Pharaohs
results.brief_description: Egyptologists and video artists takes us back 5,000 years to view the awakening of Egypt - a civilisation that created colossal structures with simple tools and massive manpower. Egypt is an amalgam of two things: the constancy of the Nile and the labour of its people. The reconstructions in this video recapture the splendour of Egypt including two of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, the Pyramids and the (Pharos) Lighthouse at Alexandria. Marvel at 25 historical recreations including the Temple of Luxor, Temple of Ammon at Karnak, Temple of Ramses, the Step Pyramid at Saqqra, and the Great Temple of Abu Simbel with its four statues of Ramses II.

results.title: The Purse
results.creator_credit: Patricia Watson, Guy Glover and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Deals with the conscience or the lack of it, and what one or the other makes us do. An elderly woman finds a purse on a bus. She takes it home and discovers it contains some money. The woman who lost the purse collects insurance. the quetsion raised is does circumstance excuse taking what is not ours.

results.title: The Purple turtle
results.brief_description: Illustrates the quality of the young child’s engagement with art activities. Designed to capture the excitement art activities offer to the kindergarten child rather than suggest a method of teaching. Presents situations and moments in which the child works with a variety of art material and techniques. Original music composed by Richard Wernick and integrated with children singing and a rhythm band.
